Job Title: B2C-Weekend Shift Lead

Location: Bethlehem, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
The Pick/Pack Lead facilitates all pick/pack work projects and related support activities in a safe, timely and efficient manner. Understands the quality specification for each product being handled and trains workforce to meet and/or exceed those expectations. Ensure compliance to policies, procedures, processes, equipment (SOP's) and recommends improvement to direct supervision. Confirms that all orders are picked and packed by the end of the day. In support of cost control efforts, this role helps and resolves operation issues as well as management of support staff. Will follow corporate and site-specific Good Manufacturing Practices and report noncompliance when observed. In addition, the candidate will observe all company safety rules and assist in enforcement as appropriate.

Schedule

Friday-Sunday 5pm-530am

Salary

$21.50 per hour plus $1.50 shift differential for hours worked. 

Responsibilities:

Delegates all pick/pack work to associates based on the business need. Checks AOR for all pick pack associates to ensure they are maintaining their work areas. Ensures all orders are picked and packed by the end of each day. Maintaining sufficient supplies for the pick/pack area. Oversees the pick/pack work area. Supervise and assist with all picking and packing issues i.e. damages, printer issues, submitting helpdesk tickets and RF problems. Train new workforce. Provides feedback to employees on job expectations. Maintain all appropriate paperworkCommunicate with ID Logistics Management to address any pick/pack issues, discuss improvements, handle labor issues, and correct picking and packing problems. Maintain pick/pack efficiency, quality, cleanliness and safety. Work all overtime requiredEnsure associates are in compliance with proper Personnel Protective Equipment. Pick/Pack Lead must always be in compliance with PPE. Follow corporate and site-specific Good Manufacturing Practices and report noncompliance when observed. Observe all company safety rules and assist in enforcement as appropriate. Other duties as assigned

Benefits:

Medical, Dental, Vision (1 day after 60 Days) (Options available)401K with matching programSTD, LTDVacation and sick time

Requirements

 High School Diploma or GED; or equivalent combination of experience and education Preferred 1 year of experience in a production environment; strong oral and written

communications skills.

 Must be able to work in a varied, fast-paced environment.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
